keyTakeAways: Sam Rivers, the bass player of Limp Bizkit, died on Saturday, October 19, 2025, according to bandmates' social media posts.
The band did not disclose the place or circumstances of Rivers' death.
Band members praised Rivers as 'pure magic' and 'the soul in the sound,' emphasizing his irreplaceable contribution to their music.
Fred Durst described Rivers as a key influence in the band's formation and emotional core, sharing a love for grunge bands like Mother Love Bone, Alice in Chains, and Stone Temple Pilots.
Rivers had a history of heavy drinking leading to liver disease, underwent a liver transplant in 2015, and later re-joined the band in 2018.

Limp Bizkit, originating in Jacksonville, Florida, blends alternative rock, heavy metal, and rap, known for their unconventional humor and hits like 'Chocolate Starfish and the Hot Dog Flavored Water'.
The band has scheduled a Central and South American tour beginning in Mexico City in late November 2025.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sam Rivers, the bass player of the nu metal band Limp Bizkit, has died, as confirmed by bandmates through social media posts. The band, which originated in Jacksonville, Florida, in the late 1990s, expressed deep grief, calling Rivers 'the soul in the sound' and 'pure magic,' and highlighted his unique ability to convey emotional depth through bass. Rivers had previously left the band in 2015 due to liver disease, underwent a transplant, and re-joined in 2018. The band continues to perform globally, with a tour scheduled to begin in Mexico City in late November 2025, despite the tragic loss. The article underscores the profound personal and musical impact Rivers had on the group and on the broader nu metal genre, rooted in their shared love of grunge music and unconventional humor.
title: Limp Bizkit Band Members Say Bass Player Sam Rivers Has Died
